subject: Management
title: The Iceberg Model of Conflict
description: Learn The Iceberg Model of Conflict in one minute.

hook.text: Two departments fought over a budget line. The real issue was a promotion snub from two years ago.

buildup.text: The visible argument is rarely the real conflict. It's just the tip of the iceberg.

discovery.text: Beneath the surface: unmet needs, past grievances, fear of loss, and identity threats.

twist.text: Solving the surface issue without addressing the root just delays the next eruption.

climax.text: Ask: what's really going on here? Listen for the feelings underneath the facts.

punchline.text: What people argue about is rarely what they're upset about.

quiz.question: What does the iceberg model of conflict illustrate?
options: The visible argument hides deeper unmet needs and grievances
All conflicts are equally complex at every level
Surface-level solutions permanently resolve most workplace disputes
